definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa

sentences.english: LeiTuos servant savannah untold hardships to find merlin to give him a prophecy.
sentences.chinese: 阿雷陀的僕人芬娜千辛萬苦去找梅林要給他預言。

sentences.english: After experiencing lots of bitterness and sorrow, they finally reached the West.
sentences.chinese: 兩人歷經千辛萬苦，終於到達西天。

sentences.english: Mary had a hard time finishing all the reading tasks.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗費盡千辛萬苦才把閱讀的任務完成。

sentences.english: The pioneers endured many hardships in setting the west.
sentences.chinese: 那些拓荒者在開發西部時歷經了千辛萬苦。

sentences.english: This is why we go to the extent to import ingredients from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 這是爲什麼我們千辛萬苦也要從海外進口材料。

sentences.english: I've gone to a great deal of trouble to get you back.
sentences.chinese: 我經歷了千辛萬苦才找把你弄回來。

sentences.english: After innumerable hardships, the prospecting team discovered a lot of new ores.
sentences.chinese: 地質勘探隊員們歷盡千辛萬苦，找到了不少新礦藏。

sentences.english: Still, the Prince eventually stumbled upon that remote corner.
sentences.chinese: 然而王子歷盡千辛萬苦，最終找到了這個地方。

sentences.english: National leaders spend much of their efforts trying to get warring factions to commit to peace again.
sentences.chinese: 國家領袖千辛萬苦地使敵對的各方能重新和平共處。

definition: (idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
